Advanced Energetic Assessment (E): Re-evaluating tissue states when initial protocols fail.
Identifying and addressing client non-compliance through the H.E.R.B.A.L. Method™ lens.
Managing 'Healing Crises' vs. adverse reactions: Clinical differentiation and protocol adjustment.
Referral protocols: When and how to transition a client to specialized medical care.

lessons.title: Final Certification Examination Preparation
outline: Comprehensive review of the Materia Medica: Key indicators, energetics, and safety profiles.
Anatomy and Physiology (A&P) review: Connecting systemic function to herbal actions.
Rapid-fire clinical simulations: Applying the H.E.R.B.A.L. Method™ to hypothetical emergency scenarios.
Mock board examination: Testing knowledge on toxicology, interactions, and formulation math.
Stress management and cognitive strategies for high-stakes clinical testing.

lessons.title: The Path to Board Certification & Professional Practice
outline: Navigating professional organizations and board certification requirements (e.g., AHG, NANP).
The H.E.R.B.A.L. Method™ as a business framework: Building a sustainable and ethical clinical practice.
Continuing Education (CE): Planning your post-certification mastery and specialty development.
Mentorship and Peer Review: The importance of clinical supervision in the first year of practice.
Final Graduation: Ceremony, credentialing, and the transition from student to Clinical Herbalist.
